byline.contributor: Richard Fausset reported from Marietta, and Alan Blinder from Atlanta.
byline.original: By RICHARD FAUSSET and ALAN BLINDER

abstract: Growing number of Christian conservatives in states where Republican governors are resisting federal plans to resettle Syrian refugees are bucking that leadership; families helping Syrians integrate into their respective communities often cite lessons in Scripture for their reasons behind reaching out and helping.

keywords.value: Mormons (Church of Jesus Christ of Latter-Day Saints)
keywords.name: subject

lead_paragraph: Republican governors resisted the resettling of Syrians, but it was their supporters, Christian conservatives, who rushed to welcome the newcomers.
